comment.author: 75774261@N08
comment._content: This photo has only 34 of the 35 First Kangaroos(Pat Walsh played 29 matches(3 Tests) on the 1908-09 tour)

comment.author: 92649696@N07
comment._content: great period photo, but whats the story with the player on the left of the front row in an arm chair?

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: The player on the left has been whited out so that this part of the photograph could be reproduced in the text of a magazine as an illustration. Rather than reproduce a regular four sided part of the photograph with background included, it was fashionable to reproduce only the figure on the white page in some newspapers and magazines. RW
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 92649696@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] thank you kindly for the explanation, much appreciated

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: PS that's a pleasure SkyeBaggie! The photograph was probably used in the magazine called The Referee which covered sport for New South Wales from 1886-1939
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
